A. $\vec \nabla V$, the multi-dimensional gradient of $V$

i.e. at every point, a vector pointing in the direction in which $V$ increases most rapidly, with magnitude describing $V$'s rate of change.

Q. Express the radial component of $\vec E$ as a function of $V$.
A. $E_r = -\frac{\partial V}{\partial r}$

Where $r$ is the radial distance from some reference point. This is a special case of the general expression $\vec E = - \vec \nabla V$.

Q. If the potential at a radial distance $r$ from some charge $q$ is $V=q/4\pi\epsilon_0r$, find $\vec E$.
A. $\vec E = q/4\pi\epsilon_0r^2 \hat r$


$E_r = -\frac{\partial V}{\partial r} = -\frac{\partial}{\partial r}\frac{q}{4\pi\epsilon_0r}$
